intro: Borreria phyteuma, commonly known as the Mexican flame flower, is a flowering plant native to Mexico and parts of Central America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its vibrant red to orange tubular flowers that bloom in clusters. It thrives in full sun and well-drained soil, making it a popular choice for gardens and landscapes. Its ornamental value is enhanced by its long blooming period, which can last from spring through fall.
